definition.name: Create Pull Request
definition.description: Creates a pull request for changes to your repository in the actions workspace
definition.author: peter-evans

inputs.name: token
inputs.description: The token that the action will use to create and update the pull request.

inputs.name: branch-token
inputs.description: The token that the action will use to create and update the branch. Defaults to the value of `token`.

inputs.name: path
inputs.description: Relative path under $GITHUB_WORKSPACE to the repository. Defaults to $GITHUB_WORKSPACE.

inputs.name: add-paths
inputs.description: A comma or newline-separated list of file paths to commit. Paths should follow git's pathspec syntax. Defaults to adding all new and modified files.

inputs.name: commit-message
inputs.description: The message to use when committing changes.

inputs.name: committer
inputs.description: The committer name and email address in the format `Display Name <email@address.com>`. Defaults to the GitHub Actions bot user.

inputs.name: author
inputs.description: The author name and email address in the format `Display Name <email@address.com>`. Defaults to the user who triggered the workflow run.

inputs.name: signoff
inputs.description: Add `Signed-off-by` line by the committer at the end of the commit log message.

inputs.name: branch
inputs.description: The pull request branch name.

inputs.name: delete-branch
inputs.description: Delete the `branch` if it doesn't have an active pull request associated with it.

inputs.name: branch-suffix
inputs.description: The branch suffix type when using the alternative branching strategy.

inputs.name: base
inputs.description: The pull request base branch. Defaults to the branch checked out in the workflow.

inputs.name: push-to-fork
inputs.description: A fork of the checked out parent repository to which the pull request branch will be pushed. e.g. `owner/repo-fork`. The pull request will be created to merge the fork's branch into the parent's base.

inputs.name: sign-commits
inputs.description: Sign commits as `github-actions[bot]` when using `GITHUB_TOKEN`, or your own bot when using GitHub App tokens.

inputs.name: title
inputs.description: The title of the pull request.

inputs.name: body
inputs.description: The body of the pull request.

inputs.name: body-path
inputs.description: The path to a file containing the pull request body. Takes precedence over `body`.

inputs.name: labels
inputs.description: A comma or newline separated list of labels.

inputs.name: assignees
inputs.description: A comma or newline separated list of assignees (GitHub usernames).

inputs.name: reviewers
inputs.description: A comma or newline separated list of reviewers (GitHub usernames) to request a review from.

inputs.name: team-reviewers
inputs.description: A comma or newline separated list of GitHub teams to request a review from. Note that a `repo` scoped Personal Access Token (PAT) may be required.

inputs.name: milestone
inputs.description: The number of the milestone to associate the pull request with.

inputs.name: draft
inputs.description: Create a draft pull request. Valid values are `true` (only on create), `always-true` (on create and update), and `false`.

inputs.name: maintainer-can-modify
inputs.description: Indicates whether maintainers can modify the pull request.

outputs.name: pull-request-url
outputs.description: The URL of the pull request.

outputs.name: pull-request-operation
outputs.description: The pull request operation performed by the action, `created`, `updated` or `closed`.

outputs.name: pull-request-head-sha
outputs.description: The commit SHA of the pull request branch.
